org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.message

Class DefaultSelectionsRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.event.AbstractDefaultSelectionsRequest
      • org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.message.DefaultSelectionsRequest

  • public final class DefaultSelectionsRequest
extends AbstractDefaultSelectionsRequest
    This POJO defines the default selection request to be processed when an SE is inserted in an observable reader.

    The default selection is defined by:

    • A list of SeRequest corresponding to one or more selection cases.
    • A MultiSeRequestProcessing indicator specifying whether all planned selections are to be executed or whether to stop at the first one that is successful.
    • A ChannelControl indicator controlling the physical channel to stipulate whether it should be closed or left open at the end of the selection process.
    Note: this class extends the AbstractDefaultSelectionsRequest class which is the one handled at the application level.
    Since:
    0.9

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultSelectionsRequest

        public DefaultSelectionsRequest(java.util.List<SeRequest> selectionSeRequests,
                                MultiSeRequestProcessing multiSeRequestProcessing,
                                ChannelControl channelControl)
        Constructor
        This object is constructed from a list of selection cases and two enum constants guiding the expected behaviour of the selection process.

        The MultiSeRequestProcessing enum is used to attempt to execute all the selection cases: MultiSeRequestProcessing.PROCESS_ALL (for example in order to list all the applications present in a secure element) or MultiSeRequestProcessing.FIRST_MATCH (to target a single application).

        The ChannelControl enum controls the closing of the physical channel at the end of the selection.

        Note: the SeRequest list should be carefully ordered in accordance with the SEs expected in the application to optimize the processing time of the selection process. The first selection case in the list will be processed first.

        Parameters:
        selectionSeRequests - A list of SeRequest embedding the selection data (must be not null).
        multiSeRequestProcessing - The multi request processing mode (must be not null).
        channelControl - The channel control (must be not null).
        Since:
        0.9
